title: On the Origin of LLMs: An Evolutionary Tree and Graph for 15,821 Large Language Models. (arXiv:2307.09793v1 [cs.DL])
abstract: Since late 2022, Large Language Models (LLMs) have become very prominent with LLMs like ChatGPT and Bard receiving millions of users. Hundreds of new LLMs are announced each week, many of which are deposited to Hugging Face, a repository of machine learning models and datasets. To date, nearly 16,000 Text Generation models have been uploaded to the site. Given the huge influx of LLMs, it is of interest to know which LLM backbones, settings, training methods, and families are popular or trending. However, there is no comprehensive index of LLMs available. We take advantage of the relatively systematic nomenclature of Hugging Face LLMs to perform hierarchical clustering and identify communities amongst LLMs using n-grams and term frequency-inverse document frequency. Our methods successfully identify families of LLMs and accurately cluster LLMs into meaningful subgroups. We present a public web application to navigate and explore Constellation, our atlas of 15,821 LLMs. Constellation rap

Title: On the Origin of LLMs: An Evolutionary Tree and Graph for 15,821 Large Language Models. (arXiv:2307.09793v1 [cs.DL])
Abstract: Since late 2022, Large Language Models (LLMs) have become very prominent with LLMs like ChatGPT and Bard receiving millions of users. Hundreds of new LLMs are announced each week, many of which are deposited to Hugging Face, a repository of machine learning models and datasets. To date, nearly 16,000 Text Generation models have been uploaded to the site. Given the huge influx of LLMs, it is of interest to know which LLM backbones, settings, training methods, and families are popular or trending. However, there is no comprehensive index of LLMs available. We take advantage of the relatively systematic nomenclature of Hugging Face LLMs to perform hierarchical clustering and identify communities amongst LLMs using n-grams and term frequency-inverse document frequency. Our methods successfully identify families of LLMs and accurately cluster LLMs into meaningful subgroups. We present a public web application to navigate and explore Constellation, our atlas of 15,821 LLMs. Constellation rap
translated_title: 关于LLMs的起源：15821个大型语言模型的进化树和图谱
translated_abstract: 自2022年底以来，大型语言模型（LLMs）已成为非常突出的研究领域，像ChatGPT和Bard这样的LLMs已经吸引了数百万个用户。每周都有数百个新的LLMs被发布，其中许多被上传到Hugging Face，这是一个机器学习模型和数据集的库。到目前为止，该网站已经上传了近16000个文本生成模型。鉴于LLMs的大量涌入，了解哪些LLM骨干、设置、训练方法和族群受到欢迎或趋势变得很有意义。然而，目前没有一个全面的LLMs索引可用。我们利用Hugging Face LLMs的相对系统的命名法对LLMs进行层次聚类，并使用n-gram和词频-逆文档频率来识别LLMs之间的联系和群体。我们的方法成功地识别了LLMs的族群，并将LLMs准确地聚类成有意义的子组。我们展示了一个公共的网页应用程序来浏览和探索Constellation，我们的15821个LLMs的图谱。
tldr: 本研究利用Hugging Face LLMs的命名法，通过层次聚类和n-gram方法，成功识别了15,821个LLMs的族群和子组，并呈现了一个公共的网页应用程序来浏览和探索这些LLMs。
en_tdlr: This study utilized the systematic nomenclature of Hugging Face LLMs to cluster and identify communities among 15,821 LLMs, presenting a public web application to navigate and explore these LLMs.
